decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

The plans submitted (drawing no. IMF2020/41/104 Revision B)  indicate a total of 8 bedrooms at 41 Dunton Road, which shall not be increased. This approval does not give permission for an increase in persons living at the property nor bedrooms available.

It is noted that the property is not listed on the Public Register for HMO's in Havering. If the property will continue to be used as an HMO, an application to apply for a HMO licence should be sought.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with Jose Mayorga of Image Fusion Ltd via email. The revisions included reducing the proposal from 9 bedrooms to 8 bedrooms and a change in the internal configuration of the house. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 4 May 2020.
